headline: Cybercrime Ring Foiled by Dynamic Animal Duo
context: An owl and a wolf joined forces to cripple cybercriminals who planned to $0. A leading cybersecurity firm suggests this may have been the biggest cybercrime ever.
The intrepid animals possess human personalities, downloaded directly into brains through a new technique, $1. The animal essences were then uploaded back to the Internet.
The wolf, going by the name of Drizz, claimed to be hunting cybercriminals on his own. "I'm a lone cyberwolf, most of the time. I worked with a $2 once, and it didn't end well.
"The moment I saw Drizz $3, I knew I had my new partner," said Tinytalon, in cyberowl form. "Watch out, hackers. You mess with the owl, you get the beak."
The wolf and owl duo refused any reward, but were last seen $4.
